feed.title: Google Cloud: Looker
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Looker

entry.content:
Looker 25.14 is expected to include the following changes, features, and fixes:

  • Expected Looker (original) deployment start: Monday, August 18, 2025
  • Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: Thursday, August 28, 2025
  • Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: Monday, August 18, 2025
  • Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) final deployment: Monday, September 1, 2025
entry.summary: Looker 25.14 Release
entry.title: Announcement: Looker 25.14 Release

entry.content: For projects that are enabled for the New LookML Runtime, the synonyms parameter is now supported. The synonyms parameter lets LookML developers provide additional context about their data that will help Conversational Analytics and other features to answer questions more accurately.
entry.summary: Synonyms parameter now supported for LookML projects enabled for the New LookML Runtime.
entry.title: Feature: New LookML Runtime Synonyms Support

entry.content: The API Usage Hourly System Activity Explore is now available. This Explore provides a detailed, hourly summary of the volume and performance of API calls that are made to your Looker instance.
entry.summary: The API Usage Hourly System Activity Explore is now available.
entry.title: Feature: New Looker API Usage Report

entry.content: Denodo 9 databases are now supported.
entry.summary: Denodo 9 databases are now supported.
entry.title: Feature: Denodo 9 Support

entry.content: The Maria JDBC Driver has been updated to version 3.5.3.
entry.summary: Maria JDBC Driver updated to 3.5.3
entry.title: Feature: Maria JDBC Driver Update

entry.content: The Athena driver has been updated to version 2.2.1.
entry.summary: The Athena driver is updated to version 2.2.1.
entry.title: Feature: Athena driver update

entry.content: The Databricks JDBC driver has been upgraded to version 2.7.3.
entry.summary: Databricks JDBC driver upgraded to 2.7.3.
entry.title: Feature: Databricks driver update

entry.content: A new JavaScript event, dashboard:tile:merge, has been added.
entry.summary: A new JavaScript event, dashboard:tile:merge, has been added.
entry.title: Feature: New JavaScript Event

entry.content: Looker now displays a notice to instance admins if the instance license has been revoked. Admins will have 14 days to correct any problems before the instance will be shut down.
entry.summary: Instance license revocation notice.
entry.title: Feature: Looker Instance License Revocation

entry.content:
The following Looker events are now visible in the System Activity Events Explore:

  • create_project
  • delete_project
  • update_project
  • create_git_deploy_key
  • delete_repository_credential
  • update_repository_credential
entry.summary: New project events are available in the System Activity Events Explore.
entry.title: Feature: New Project Events

entry.content: A new Customer Engineer Advanced Editor default role has been added and can be used to grant support access to Google Cloud customer engineers.
entry.summary: A new role, Customer Engineer Advanced Editor, is available to grant support access to Google Cloud customer engineers.
entry.title: Feature: New Role Added

entry.content: The Query Concurrency System Activity Explore is now available. This Explore can help you identify periods of high load and investigate performance bottlenecks that are related to database connection limits. Note: This feature was included in the Looker 25.12 release notes but its launch was delayed.
entry.summary: Identify high load periods and investigate performance bottlenecks related to database connection limits.
entry.title: Feature: Query Concurrency System Activity Explore Now Available

entry.content: New visualizations have been added to the Database Performance dashboard and the Instance Performance dashboard in System Activity.
entry.summary: New visualizations are now available in the System Activity dashboards.
entry.title: Feature: New visualizations in System Activity

entry.content:
Looker 25.14 contains the following accessibility improvements:

  • ARIA labels have been added to iframes that contain custom visualizations.
  • ARIA labels have been added to legends on visualizations.
  • ARIA labels have been added to modals.
  • ARIA labels have been added to the Looker page header and logo.
  • ARIA labels have been added to untitled dashboard tiles.
  • Keyboard focus has been improved on modals.
  • Text contrast has been increased on banners.
  • Dashboard filters stay in focus while users are typing.
  • Users can use the Explore from here link in a drill menu by using the keyboard.
  • Users can interact with Single Value visualizations by using the keyboard.
  • PDF rendering progress messages have been updated to better integrate with screen readers.
entry.summary: Looker 25.14: Accessibility Improvements
entry.title: Fixed: Looker 25.14 release notes

entry.content: The LookML validation spinner now correctly stops if there is an error with the server's validation process.
entry.summary: LookML validation spinner stops on server error.
entry.title: Fixed: LookML Validation Fix

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where a route that wasn't intended for embedding was allowed to be embedded. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Route embedding fixed.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Route Embedding

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where "Create view from table" would fail if it was initiated from a LookML subfolder. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The "Create view from table" feature now works correctly, even when initiated from a LookML subfolder.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: "Create view from table" issue in LookML subfolders

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where color palettes with Japanese labels could not be added or removed. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Japanese labels for color palettes fixed.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Color Palette Issue

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where getting LookML for dashboards wouldn't preserve all query filters even if they overlapped with dashboard-level filters. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: LookML dashboards now preserve all query filters.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: LookML dashboard filters

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where include statements for empty folders that used single-slash syntax returned an unrecognized project reference error. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: `include` statements for empty folders with single-slash syntax now work correctly, resolving an unrecognized project reference error.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Include statements for empty folders

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where multiple tooltips could be displayed at once. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Multiple tooltips displayed at once have been fixed.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Multiple Tooltips Issue

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where project names weren't fully sanitized. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Project names are now fully sanitized.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed project name sanitization

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where projects that have not been deployed to production wouldn't appear in a user's list of available projects. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Projects not deployed to production now appear in the user's project list.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed project visibility

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where removing fields from embedded dashboard tiles could become impossible. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Fix for embedded dashboard tile field removal.
entry.title: Fixed: Issue Fix

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where resetting a project's git connection and attempting to use a bare repo would fail. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Fixed an issue with bare repo git connections.
entry.title: Fixed: Git Connection Fix

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where sorting a pivoted column in the drill modal could sort all pivoted columns instead of just the selected one. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Sorting pivoted columns in drill modal now works correctly.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Sorting Issue in Drill Modal

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where special characters such as slashes, ampersands, and question marks were allowed in BigQuery and Spanner connection names. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Special characters are no longer allowed in BigQuery and Spanner connection names.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Special characters in connection names

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the HTTP error codes for moving and copying dashboards and Looks could return 422 when they should return 404. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: HTTP error codes for moving and copying dashboards and Looks now return 404 as expected, instead of 422.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: HTTP error codes for dashboard and Look operations

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the last accessed time for Looks that were saved to a dashboard as Looks wasn't updated when the dashboard was accessed. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Looks that were saved to a dashboard were not updating their last accessed time. This has been fixed.
entry.title: Fixed: Look Last Accessed Time Update

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the MoreVert button would not be disabled when no options were available in the menu. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The MoreVert button is now correctly disabled when no menu options are available.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: MoreVert Button Behavior

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the new dashboard name wasn't preserved when a LookML dashboard was copied to a folder. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Dashboard name preserved after copying LookML dashboard to a folder.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Dashboard name preservation

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where unfavoriting a dashboard or Look on a board would not persist. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Unfavoriting dashboards and Looks on a board now persists.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed unfavoriting issue

entry.content: Connected Sheets can now connect to a Looker (Google Cloud core) private IP instance by using the Looker instance ID. Note: This item was added on August 14, 2025.
entry.summary: Connected Sheets now connects to Looker private IP instances using the Looker instance ID.
entry.title: Feature: Connected Sheets Looker Integration

entry.content:
The Code Interpreter in Conversational Analytics is available in Preview for Looker (original) and Looker (Google Cloud core) instances. The Code Interpreter translates your natural language questions into Python code and executes that code to provide advanced analysis and visualizations. The Code Interpreter is disabled by default.

  • Looker (original) instances must be on Looker 25.8 or later. Looker admins can manage enablement for the Code Interpreter on the Gemini in Looker admin page of the Looker (original) instance.
  • Looker (Google Cloud core) instances must be on Looker 25.10 or later. Looker admins can manage enablement for the Code Interpreter on the Gemini in Looker admin page of the Looker (Google Cloud core) instance.
entry.summary: Introducing the Code Interpreter for advanced analysis and visualizations, now in Preview for Looker.
entry.title: Announcement: New Code Interpreter Feature

entry.content:
Looker 25.12 is expected to include the following changes, features, and fixes:

  • Expected Looker (original) deployment start: Monday, July 28, 2025
  • Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: Thursday, August 7, 2025
  • Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: Monday, July 28, 2025
  • Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) final deployment: Wednesday, July 30, 2025
entry.summary: Looker 25.12 Release
entry.title: Announcement: Looker 25.12 Release

entry.content: Because of security concerns, text tiles no longer support the form and input Markdown elements.
entry.summary: Text tiles no longer support form and input Markdown elements due to security concerns.
entry.title: Breaking: Breaking News

entry.content: The Oracle JDBC driver has been updated to version 19.25.
entry.summary: Oracle JDBC driver updated.
entry.title: Feature: Oracle JDBC Driver Update

entry.content: For faster response time for queries in BigQuery, Looker will execute BigQuery queries by using jobCreationMode=JOB_CREATION_OPTIONAL. If BigQuery can return immediate results, it will run the query without creating a job, so the record in the Looker query history will have a BigQuery query ID instead of a BigQuery job ID. See the Understanding query performance metrics documentation page for more information about the BigQuery BI Engine metrics.
entry.summary: Looker now uses an improved method for running BigQuery queries, leading to faster response times.
entry.title: Feature: Faster BigQuery Queries in Looker

entry.content: The Query Concurrency System Activity Explore is now available. This Explore can help you identify periods of high load and investigate performance bottlenecks that are related to database connection limits. Note: This feature launch was delayed and is now available in Looker 25.14. This item was updated on August 13, 2025.
entry.summary: Query concurrency is now available to help identify load periods and investigate performance bottlenecks.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: Query Concurrency

entry.content:
Looker 25.12 contains the following accessibility improvements:

  • Improved contrast for exit buttons on dialogs
  • Improved contrast for checkbox borders
entry.summary: Accessibility improvements in Looker 25.12
entry.title: Fixed: Looker 25.12 Accessibility Update

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where pull requests could display a different user than the pull request's owner. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Pull requests now display the correct owner.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Pull Request Owner Display Issue

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the System Activity Query Metrics Explore was not reliably populating with data. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: System Activity Query Metrics Explore data population issue fixed.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed System Activity Query Metrics Explore

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where API users could view a list of users on a Looker instance, even if they didn't have the see_users permission. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: API users can now only view users if they have the `see_users` permission.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: API user permissions

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the response headers from some API calls were not set by Looker. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Looker API response headers are now correctly set.
entry.title: Fixed: Looker API Header Fix

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where exploring from a dashboard tile while editing a dashboard could result in a permissions error, even if the user had permission to view the Explore. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Permissions error fixed when exploring from dashboard tile.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Dashboard tile exploration error

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the row limit in an Explore could display a blank field when the row limit was set to 5,000. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Row limit in explore now displays correctly.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Explore Row Limit Issue

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where some users were unable to create or edit BigQuery OAuth connections. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Fixed an issue with BigQuery OAuth connections.
entry.title: Fixed: BigQuery OAuth Connection Issue Fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where SQL Runner would display a blank page if a user changed the visualization type after pivoting on a dimension. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: SQL Runner fixed blank page issue after visualization change.
entry.title: Fixed: Bug Fix

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where some queries to the internal database were unoptimized, affecting instance performance. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Internal database queries optimized.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Instance performance improved

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where a visualization template could fail to be displayed in the list of templates if the name contained certain unicode characters. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Visualization template display issue fixed.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Visualization template issue

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where invalid query killing statements could cause unnecessarily verbose log outputs. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Invalid query killing statements no longer produce verbose logs.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed verbose logs

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where API users without the explore permission could access visualization templates. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: API users without explore permission can no longer access visualization templates.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Visualization template access

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where Looker could return a 500 error while retrieving dashboard details if the details contained non-UTF-8 characters. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Looker dashboard error fixed.
entry.title: Fixed: Looker error fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where forecasting didn't work properly on fields that were based on JSON data. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Forecasting on JSON-based fields now works correctly.
entry.title: Fixed: Forecasting Fix

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where Looker didn't properly sanitize slash characters in git references that were used for remote dependencies. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Looker no longer has issues with git references.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed Git Reference Issue

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where fields could be sorted differently when a visualization was downloaded or scheduled as a PNG. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Fields are now sorted correctly in downloaded PNGs.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Visualization Sort Order

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the all_connections API call could ignore the fields parameter. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The `all_connections` API call now correctly handles the `fields` parameter.
entry.title: Fixed: API Call Fix

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where a map visualization would display drill links for fields that were hidden from the visualization. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Map visualization drill links fixed.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Map visualization drill links

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where some System Activity tables were missing the element_id field. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: System Activity tables missing element_id field fixed.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: System Activity Tables

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where subtotals could be incorrectly formatted in PDF downloads when an HTML parameter was defined on the field and the "Expand tables to show all rows" option was enabled. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Subtotals formatting in PDF downloads has been fixed when HTML parameters are used with row expansion enabled.
entry.title: Fixed: Formatting Issue Resolved

entry.content: The Looker IDE now checks for subparameters in local and remote dependencies and displays a more informative error if the subparameters are missing. Local dependencies must be defined with a project subparameter, while remote dependencies require both a url subparameter and a ref subparameter.
entry.summary: IDE now checks for subparameters in local and remote dependencies. Local dependencies require a project subparameter, while remote dependencies need both url and ref subparameters for more informative error messages.
entry.title: Fixed: IDE dependency checks improved

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where editing a merged query in an embedded session would open in a new tab. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Editing a merged query in an embedded session now opens in a new tab as expected.
entry.title: Fixed: Bug Fix for Merged Query Editing

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where Looker could generate duplicate SQL table references if a PDT referenced a table directly as well as through a join. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Looker no longer generates duplicate SQL table references when a PDT references a table directly as well as through a join.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed duplicate SQL references in Looker

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where some PDT regeneration events were not tracked in System Activity. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: PDT regeneration events were not tracked in System Activity.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed PDT regeneration tracking

entry.content: When an Explore is saved as a new dashboard, Looker will create advanced filter type dashboard filters, rather than drop-down type dashboard filters, for number type parameters.
entry.summary: Looker now creates advanced filters for number parameters when saving an Explore as a dashboard.
entry.title: Fixed: Looker dashboard filter update

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where SAML authentication could fail for a Looker (Google Cloud core) instance. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: SAML authentication issue fixed.
entry.title: Fixed: SAML authentication fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the Looker Marketplace toggle was not being displayed in Looker core instances for users who were granted Admin permissions with an IAM role. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Looker Marketplace toggle now displayed correctly for IAM admins.
entry.title: Fixed: Looker Marketplace Fix

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where installing multiple drivers for the same database type on a customer-hosted instance could cause Looker to display an error. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: An issue with installing multiple drivers for the same database type on a customer-hosted instance has been fixed.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed driver installation issue

entry.content: The Fast Dev Mode Transition feature is out of Labs and is now generally available. The Fast Dev Mode Transition feature improves the performance of Development Mode on your instance by loading LookML projects in read-only mode until a developer clicks the Create Developer Copy button for the project. Note: This item was added on July 8, 2025.
entry.summary: Fast Dev Mode Transition is now generally available, improving development mode performance by loading LookML projects in read-only mode until a developer creates a copy.
entry.title: Feature: Fast Dev Mode Transition Now Generally Available

entry.content: The Fast Dev Mode Transition feature is now available for Looker (Google Cloud core). The Fast Dev Mode Transition feature improves the performance of Development Mode on your instance by loading LookML projects in read-only mode until a developer clicks the Create Developer Copy button for the project. Note: This item was added on July 8, 2025.
entry.summary: Looker's Fast Dev Mode Transition is now available, improving instance performance by loading LookML projects in read-only mode until a developer initiates a copy. This enhancement applies to Looker (Google Cloud core).
entry.title: Feature: New Fast Dev Mode Transition for Looker

entry.content:
The following feature is generally available for Looker reports:

  • The Looker connector can now connect to a private IP (private services access) only Looker (Google Cloud core) instance or to a private IP (Private Service Connect) Looker (Google Cloud core) instance using the Looker instance ID.
entry.summary: The Looker connector now supports connecting to Looker (Google Cloud core) instances using private IP addresses, including those with Private Service Connect.
entry.title: Feature: Looker connector supports private IP connections

entry.content:
Looker 25.10 is expected to include the following changes, features, and fixes:

  • Expected Looker (original) deployment start: Tuesday, June 17, 2025
  • Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: Thursday, June 26, 2025
  • Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: Monday, June 16, 2025
  • Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) final deployment: Monday, June 30, 2025
entry.summary: Looker 25.10 release is scheduled for June 2025, with deployments for Looker (original) starting June 17th and Looker (Google Cloud core) starting June 16th. Final deployments and downloads will be available by June 26th for original and June 30th for Google Cloud core.
entry.title: Announcement: Looker 25.10 Release Notes

entry.content:
The Embed SDK has been upgraded to release 2.0.0. While the 2.0.0 API is backwards-compatible with Embed SDK 1.8.x, the underlying implementation has changed for some functionality. SDK 1.8.x exported a number of classes. SDK 2.0.0 replaces these classes with interfaces that are marked as deprecated (alternative interfaces are identified). We recommend that applications use the interfaces that have an 'I' prefix (the interfaces that have prefixes are identical to the interfaces that don't have them). Applications that are upgraded to SDK 2.0.0 should continue to work and behave as they did previously. To take advantage of the API improvements, some refactoring will be required. The following major changes are included in Embed SDK 2.0.0:

  • Navigating between dashboards, Explores, and Looks no longer requires that an iframe be recreated. Instead, the loadDashboard, loadLook, loadExplore, and loadUrl methods can be used to navigate within the Looker iframe.
  • connect now returns a unified connection rather than a connection that is related only to a dashboard, a Look, or an Explore. The unified connection allows embedding applications to detect a user navigating inside the iframe.
  • Support for additional Looker embedded content has been added for Looker reports and query visualizations.

Note: This item was added on June 13, 2025.
entry.summary: The Embed SDK has been upgraded to version 2.0.0. This new version is backward-compatible with 1.8.x but introduces changes to how classes are exported, recommending the use of interfaces instead. Key improvements include eliminating the need to recreate iframes for navigation, a unified connection object for better event detection, and expanded support for Looker reports and query visualizations. Some refactoring may be needed to leverage the new features.
entry.title: Breaking: Embed SDK upgraded to 2.0.0

entry.content: For period-over-period (PoP) measures, a new subparameter, value_to_date, is available. When a PoP measure is defined with value_to_date:yes, Looker will calculate the amount of time in the current timeframe at the time that the query is run and apply that amount of time when it calculates the values for previous periods.
entry.summary: Looker's period-over-period measures now support a `value_to_date` subparameter. This allows for more accurate calculations of previous periods by considering the current timeframe when the query is executed.
entry.title: Feature: New subparameter for period-over-period measures

entry.content: The Firebolt JDBC driver has been updated to version 3.5.0.
entry.summary: The Firebolt JDBC driver has been updated to version 3.5.0, offering improved performance and reliability for data connectivity.
entry.title: Feature: Firebolt JDBC driver updated to version 3.5.0

entry.content: The Hive JDBC driver has been updated to version 4.0.1.
entry.summary: The Hive JDBC driver has been updated to version 4.0.1.
entry.title: Feature: Hive JDBC driver updated

entry.content: The MS SQL JDBC driver has been updated to version 12.10.0.
entry.summary: The MS SQL JDBC driver has been updated to version 12.10.0.
entry.title: Feature: MS SQL JDBC driver updated

entry.content: The Teradata JDBC driver has been updated to version 20.00.00.45.
entry.summary: The Teradata JDBC driver has been updated to version 20.00.00.45.
entry.title: Feature: Teradata JDBC driver updated

entry.content: The Vertica JDBC driver has been updated to version 24.2.0-1.
entry.summary: The Vertica JDBC driver has been updated to version 24.2.0-1.
entry.title: Feature: Vertica JDBC Driver Update

entry.content: The new Content Guardrails admin panel lets Looker admins limit both the ability for users to add or execute merged results queries on dashboards and the use of the dashboard auto-refresh option. Limiting merged results queries and dashboard auto-refreshes can reduce the number of queries that are sent to the database and improve dashboard performance. Note: This item was added on June 12, 2025.
entry.summary: Looker admins can now control user access to merged results queries and dashboard auto-refresh functionality. This feature helps reduce database load and enhance dashboard performance by limiting query execution.
entry.title: Feature: Control Merged Results and Auto-Refresh

entry.content: The Looker Continuous Integration (CI) features let you run tests on your LookML project to deliver more reliable, efficient, and user-friendly data experiences. You can use the CI validators to catch issues with SQL, data test, content, and LookML before they hit production to verify your LookML and prevent query errors for your users. You can also configure the CI validators to run automatically when a pull request is submitted to your LookML repository. Note: This item was added on June 23, 2025.
entry.summary: Looker's new Continuous Integration features enable automated testing of your LookML projects, catching SQL, data test, content, and LookML issues before they reach production. This ensures more reliable and user-friendly data experiences by preventing query errors.
entry.title: Feature: Looker CI Features

entry.content:
This release contains the following accessibility improvements:

  • Increased contrast ratio for graphic elements, including icon bullets
  • Improved contrast for download links and unemphasized text to comply with Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) Level AA
entry.summary: This release includes accessibility improvements such as increased contrast for graphic elements and links, ensuring compliance with WCAG Level AA standards.
entry.title: Fixed: Accessibility Improvements

entry.content: The Tile Actions kebab menu now includes the name of the dashboard tile in its aria-label value.
entry.summary: The Tile Actions kebab menu's aria-label now includes the dashboard tile's name for improved accessibility.
entry.title: Fixed: Accessibility improvements for Tile Actions menu

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where SDK API calls could return a 500 error if optional headers were not specified. The API calls now work as expected even if optional headers are not included.
entry.summary: SDK API calls now correctly handle missing optional headers, resolving the 500 error.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: SDK API call errors

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the PDT Override Service Account field was not available for connections that use OAuth credentials. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The PDT Override Service Account field is now available for connections using OAuth credentials, resolving a previous issue.
entry.title: Fixed: PDT Override Service Account Field Fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the Manage Access dialog on a folder could load slowly if the Looker instance has a large number of groups. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The Manage Access dialog for folders now loads quickly, even with a large number of groups in the Looker instance.
entry.title: Fixed: Manage Access dialog performance improved

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where, previously, testing a new OAuth connection before saving would run connection tests on an empty connection. OAuth settings must now be saved before running connection tests. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Previously, testing a new OAuth connection before saving would run connection tests on an empty connection. OAuth settings must now be saved before running connection tests. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: OAuth connection testing

entry.content: The OAuth Tenant ID field will no longer appear in connections for which it is not relevant. The only connection type that supports this field is Trino.
entry.summary: The OAuth Tenant ID field is now hidden for irrelevant connections. This field is only relevant for Trino connections.
entry.title: Fixed: OAuth Tenant ID field updated

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the API calls to run git connection tests would fail unless the user was in dev mode. These calls now work as expected whether the user is in production or development mode.
entry.summary: API calls for git connection tests now function correctly in both production and development modes, resolving a previous issue where they only worked in dev mode.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed git connection test API calls

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where drill downs wouldn't be displayed for a field if the first field value had null values. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Drill downs now display correctly even if the first field value is null.
entry.title: Fixed: Drill down issue fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where assigning the user attribute looker_internal_email_domain_allowlist on the SAML config page would return a 500 error. This user attribute is not designed to be assigned at the user level, so the option to assign it has been removed from the SAML config page.
entry.summary: The ability to assign the user attribute `looker_internal_email_domain_allowlist` on the SAML config page has been removed due to a bug that caused a 500 error. This attribute is not intended for user-level assignment.
entry.title: Fixed: User attribute assignment fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where restarting the Looker instance during a folder sync could cause the instance to fail to start.
entry.summary: The Looker instance could fail to start after being restarted during a folder sync. This issue has now been resolved.
entry.title: Fixed: Looker instance startup issue fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where selecting fields from the Session view in the System Activity User Explore could cause fanout. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The fanout issue when selecting fields from the Session view in the System Activity User Explore has been resolved. This feature now functions correctly.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed fanout issue in System Activity User Explore

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the count table calculation function could return incorrect values if its inputs included a list with null values. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The `count` table calculation function now correctly handles lists with null values, returning accurate results.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed incorrect calculation in `count` table function

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the drill menu did not properly translate some entries when the locale was set to Swedish (sv_SE). This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The drill menu in the product now correctly translates all entries when the locale is set to Swedish.
entry.title: Fixed: Drill menu translation fixed for Swedish locale

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where drilling on a query with subtotals could display incorrect values. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Drilling on a query with subtotals now displays the correct values, resolving a previous issue.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed incorrect values in queries with subtotals

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where filtering on a custom dimension that references a datetime type field could return the following error message: No matching signature. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Filtering on a custom dimension that references a datetime type field could return an error. This issue has now been resolved and the feature performs as expected.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed issue with custom dimension filtering

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the LookML validator would return a 500 error if a LookML file contained a sum_distinct measure for a database that doesn't support sum_distinct measures. The LookML validator now returns a more descriptive error message.
entry.summary: The LookML validator no longer returns a 500 error for LookML files with `sum_distinct` measures on unsupported databases. Instead, it provides a more informative error message, improving the developer experience.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed LookML validator error for sum_distinct measures

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where entering the value 12:00 in the Time field of an alert schedule dialog would input 00:00 instead.
entry.summary: The Time field in alert schedules would incorrectly display 00:00 when 12:00 was entered. This issue has now been resolved.
entry.title: Fixed: Time field input corrected

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where changes to PDT override settings would not be saved. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: PDT override settings are now saved correctly after an issue that prevented this has been resolved. The feature is functioning as expected.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed issue with PDT override settings

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where PDTs could fail to rebuild with the following error message: undefined method trace_id_hex. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: PDTs failing to rebuild due to an "undefined method trace_id_hex" error have been resolved. The feature now functions correctly.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed PDT rebuild issue

entry.content: You can now embed Looker reports on Looker (original) instances when Looker reports and the Embed Looker reports Labs features are enabled for your instance. Looker reports are available in preview.
entry.summary: Looker reports are now available for embedding on Looker (original) instances with the relevant features enabled. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Embedding Looker reports is now available

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where LDAP authentication could fail with the following error message: no implicit conversion of Hash into String. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: LDAP authentication no longer fails with a hash to string conversion error.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed LDAP authentication issue

entry.content: The Code Interpreter in Conversational Analytics is now available in Preview. The Code Interpreter translates your natural language questions into Python code and executes that code to provide advanced analysis and visualizations. The Code Interpreter is disabled by default. Admins of Looker (Google Cloud core) instances can manage enablement for the Code Interpreter on the Gemini in Looker admin page. Note: This item was added on June 23, 2025.
entry.summary: A new code interpreter feature is available for conversational analytics, allowing users to translate natural language questions into Python code for advanced analysis and visualizations. This feature is disabled by default and can be managed by instance administrators.
entry.title: Feature: New Code Interpreter Available for Conversational Analytics

entry.content:
Gemini in Looker will be enabled by default for Looker (original) instances that meet at least one of the following criteria:

  • The Automated Gemini in Looker enablement and user management setting on the Settings page in the Looker Admin panel was previously enabled.
  • The instance is updated to Looker 25.6 or later after June 9, 2025.

Instances that are hosted in the EMEA region and those that are enrolled in Looker's Extended Support Release (ESR) program are exempt from automatic enablement.

Looker admins can still manage Gemini in Looker enablement manually on the Gemini in Looker page in the Admin panel.
entry.summary: Gemini in Looker will be automatically enabled by default for Looker (original) instances starting with version 25.6, provided they meet specific criteria or had the feature enabled previously. However, instances in the EMEA region or those in the ESR program are exempt from this automatic enablement. Admins retain manual control over the feature
entry.title: Announcement: Gemini in Looker enablement update

entry.content: When the Automated Gemini in Looker enablement and user management setting is enabled, the Gemini Default Users group is created automatically for instances that use an open system configuration. The Gemini Default Users group is populated automatically with all existing users and any new users who are added to the instance.
entry.summary: A new feature is available for Looker, regarding the Automated Gemini enablement and user management. When the relevant setting is enabled, a Gemini Default Users group is automatically created and populated with all existing and new users for instances using an open system configuration.
entry.title: Feature: Automated Gemini in Looker
